title: Outliers on distribution of number of siblings

content.description: The number of siblings was recorded for each student of a group of 80 students. Some summary statistics and a histogram displaying the results are shown below.
content.question: An outlier is often defined as a number that is more than 1.5 times the interquartile range below the first quartile or above the third quartile. Using the definition of an outlier and the given information, which of the following can be concluded?

choices.label: The median is greater than the mean, and the distribution has no outliers.
The median is greater than the mean, and the distribution has only one outlier.
The median is greater than the mean, and the distribution has two outliers.
The median is less than the mean, and the distribution has only one outlier.
The median is less than the mean, and the distribution has two outliers.

content.answer: The median is less than the mean, and the distribution has two outliers.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
